comments.body: do these need dashes?  The old values had dashes (yaml lists vs map keys)?

No dashes. This is pushed to my fork and works. Ive also got both v1.0 and v1.1 working in my local build (testing the v1.1 setup by using a copy of the v1.0 .html files).

I think you have the option to list individual collection names (and use dashes) but if you add meta data (ie how ive forced/ensure our collections get built and use "output: true"), then you have to remove dashes.

The old dashes were left in there from my early testing/trying to get this working for v1.0. Dashes were used initially because a few sources I used online, including the [Jekyll help docs](http://jekyllrb.com/docs/collections/#step-1-tell-jekyll-to-read-in-your-collection) are a little confusing and have examples both with and without dashes.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +86,90 @@# Collections (for versioning docs)
collections:
   v1.1:
      output: true
   v1.0:
